drupalNodeEvent.title: Watch Dog or Guard Dog? Australian media and the China Threat

field_organizers.processed: Australian Centre on China in the World, The Australian National University

field_description.processed: What is the role of Australian media, especially news media, in shaping a sense of who we are as a nation, amidst talk of a Cold War with China? How do these media produce public knowledge about a country that is increasingly imagined as its strategic enemy? This talk addresses these questions through the politics of voice, framing, and truth-claiming in journalism, and considers how the answers to these questions may impact on democracy and multicultural citizenship in Australia.
